medical_history.chief_complaint: Patient admitted due to a new pulmonary lesion.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been in good health until approximately 5 years before admission, when he experienced decreased appetite and epigastric discomfort. Persistent pain and gastroesophageal reflux developed approximately 2.5 years prior to admission. Additionally, back and chest pain occurred 3 months before admission, along with bilateral sharp, pleuritic pain. Symptoms of early satiety emerged after abdominal surgery, and weight loss and fatigue were noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of gastric cancer and H. pylori infection. Previous gastric surgeries and treatments for hiatal hernia, gastroesophageal reflux, and duodenal ulcers.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of gastric cancer at 39 years; mother died of bronchitis at 65 years. Healthy children and siblings.
medical_history.social_history: Former smoker for 25 years, stopped 3 months before admission. Born in Brazil, immigrated to the United States over 20 years ago. Experienced weight loss and poor health, left job in a factory prior to admission, and lived with family until 4 months before admission when they returned to Brazil.
